replies.body:
DDR5 = Memory of a GPU
Its going to be easier if you list it like so:

Intel core i7 @ 3.1 GHz
AMD Radeon 255 (Not to good ;-;)
32 GB Ram (Really not needed)
4TB HDD
500W PSU

Tbh, If you payed more than 600 for it, Waste..

Intel core i5 4690k LGA1150 (CPU socket)
NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti
G.Skill RipJaws 8GB 1866 DDR3-RAM
ASrock Z87 LGA1150 Extreme4 Motherboard (Capable of overclocking)
Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO CPU cooler
Seagate Barracuda 1TB HDD
Samsung 840 128GB SSD
NZXT Phantom (White) PC case
Corsair 600W PSU.

For a cheaper one:

AMD FX-4300 3.5GHz 6-core APU
Asus A88Xm-a (Idk the APU socket for the AMD hope its an FM2+)
8GB DDR3-1600 RAM
Gigabyte Radeon R7 270 / Radeon HD 7975
Rest I didnt look into that much :P
